user.title: Choose a name for the Adaptive Lighting instance
user.description: Every instance can contain multiple lights!

init.title: Adaptive Lighting options
init.description: All settings for a Adaptive Lighting component. The option names correspond with the YAML settings. No options are shown if you have this entry defined in YAML.

data.lights: lights: List of light entity_ids to be controlled (may be empty). 🌟
data.prefer_rgb_color: prefer_rgb_color: Whether to prefer RGB color adjustment over light color temperature when possible. 🌈
data.include_config_in_attributes: include_config_in_attributes: Show all options as attributes on the switch in Home Assistant when set to `true`. 📝
data.initial_transition: initial_transition: Duration of the first transition when lights turn from `off` to `on` in seconds. ⏲️
data.sleep_transition: sleep_transition: Duration of transition when "sleep mode" is toggled in seconds. 😴
data.transition: transition: Duration of transition when lights change, in seconds. 🕑
data.transition_until_sleep: transition_until_sleep: When enabled, Adaptive Lighting will treat sleep settings as the minimum, transitioning to these values after sunset. 🌙
data.interval: interval: Frequency to adapt the lights, in seconds. 🔄
data.min_color_temp: min_color_temp: Warmest color temperature in Kelvin. 🔥
data.max_color_temp: max_color_temp: Coldest color temperature in Kelvin. ❄️
data.sleep_brightness: sleep_brightness: Brightness percentage of lights in sleep mode. 😴
data.sleep_rgb_or_color_temp: sleep_rgb_or_color_temp: Use either `"rgb_color"` or `"color_temp"` in sleep mode. 🌙
data.sleep_color_temp: sleep_color_temp: Color temperature in sleep mode (used when `sleep_rgb_or_color_temp` is `color_temp`) in Kelvin. 😴
data.sleep_rgb_color: sleep_rgb_color: RGB color in sleep mode (used when `sleep_rgb_or_color_temp` is "rgb_color"). 🌈
data.sunrise_time: sunrise_time: Set a fixed time (HH:MM:SS) for sunrise. 🌅
data.max_sunrise_time: max_sunrise_time: Set the latest virtual sunrise time (HH:MM:SS), allowing for earlier real sunrises. 🌅
data.sunrise_offset: sunrise_offset: Adjust sunrise time with a positive or negative offset in seconds. ⏰
data.sunset_time: sunset_time: Set a fixed time (HH:MM:SS) for sunset. 🌇
data.min_sunset_time: min_sunset_time: Set the earliest virtual sunset time (HH:MM:SS), allowing for later real sunsets. 🌇
data.sunset_offset: sunset_offset: Adjust sunset time with a positive or negative offset in seconds. ⏰
data.only_once: only_once: Adapt lights only when they are turned on (`true`) or keep adapting them (`false`). 🔄
data.take_over_control: take_over_control: Disable Adaptive Lighting if another source calls `light.turn_on` while lights are on and being adapted. Note that this calls `homeassistant.update_entity` every `interval`! 🔒
data.detect_non_ha_changes: detect_non_ha_changes: Detect non-`light.turn_on` state changes and stop adapting lights. Requires `take_over_control`. 🕵️
data.separate_turn_on_commands: separate_turn_on_commands: Use separate `light.turn_on` calls for color and brightness, needed for some light types. 🔀
data.send_split_delay: send_split_delay: Delay (ms) between `separate_turn_on_commands` for lights that don't support simultaneous brightness and color setting. ⏲️
data.adapt_delay: adapt_delay: Wait time (seconds) between light turn on and Adaptive Lighting applying changes. Might help to avoid flickering. ⏲️
data.autoreset_control_seconds: autoreset_control_seconds: Automatically reset the manual control after a number of seconds. Set to 0 to disable. ⏲️

error.entity_missing: One or more selected light entities are missing from Home Assistant
